storyTitle: As Employee, I want to submit schedule change requests to achieve timely and accurate schedule updates

testCases.title: Validate successful schedule change request submission with valid data
preconditions: Employee has valid login credentials
Employee is authenticated via OAuth2
Schedule change request submission page is accessible
Supporting document is prepared (PDF/DOC format, under size limit)
ScheduleChangeRequests table is accessible and operational

steps.action: Navigate to schedule change request submission page
steps.expectedResult: Submission form is displayed with all mandatory fields including employee ID, current schedule, requested schedule, reason, effective date, and file upload option

steps.action: Enter valid employee ID in the employee ID field
steps.expectedResult: Employee ID is accepted and no validation error is shown

steps.action: Enter valid current schedule details (date and time)
steps.expectedResult: Current schedule data is accepted in correct date format without validation errors

steps.action: Enter valid requested schedule details (date and time)
steps.expectedResult: Requested schedule data is accepted in correct date format without validation errors

steps.action: Enter a valid reason for the schedule change request
steps.expectedResult: Reason text is accepted without validation errors

steps.action: Select a valid effective date for the schedule change
steps.expectedResult: Effective date is accepted in correct format without validation errors

steps.action: Upload a supporting document using the file upload option
steps.expectedResult: Document is uploaded successfully, file name is displayed, and no size limit error occurs

steps.action: Click the Submit button to submit the schedule change request
steps.expectedResult: Request is saved to ScheduleChangeRequests table, confirmation message is displayed with request ID, timestamp is logged, and submission completes within 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify the request appears in the submitted requests list
steps.expectedResult: Newly submitted request is visible in the list with status 'Pending' and correct timestamp

postconditions: Schedule change request is stored in ScheduleChangeRequests table
Request has a unique ID and timestamp
Request status is set to 'Pending'
Supporting document is attached to the request
Audit log contains submission entry
Employee can view the submitted request in their request history

testCases.title: Verify validation errors on incomplete schedule change request submission
preconditions: Employee has valid login credentials
Employee is authenticated via OAuth2
Schedule change request submission page is accessible
ScheduleChangeRequests table is accessible and operational

steps.action: Navigate to schedule change request submission page
steps.expectedResult: Submission form is displayed with all mandatory fields clearly marked

steps.action: Leave the employee ID field empty
steps.expectedResult: Field remains empty without pre-filled data

steps.action: Leave the current schedule field empty
steps.expectedResult: Field remains empty without pre-filled data

steps.action: Leave the requested schedule field empty
steps.expectedResult: Field remains empty without pre-filled data

steps.action: Leave the reason field empty
steps.expectedResult: Field remains empty without pre-filled data

steps.action: Leave the effective date field empty
steps.expectedResult: Field remains empty without pre-filled data

steps.action: Click the Submit button to attempt submission with empty mandatory fields
steps.expectedResult: Inline validation errors are displayed for each missing mandatory field with clear error messages such as 'Employee ID is required', 'Current schedule is required', 'Requested schedule is required', 'Reason is required', and 'Effective date is required'

steps.action: Fill in the employee ID field with valid data
steps.expectedResult: Validation error for employee ID is cleared and field shows valid state

steps.action: Fill in the current schedule field with valid date and time
steps.expectedResult: Validation error for current schedule is cleared and field shows valid state

steps.action: Fill in the requested schedule field with valid date and time
steps.expectedResult: Validation error for requested schedule is cleared and field shows valid state

steps.action: Fill in the reason field with valid text
steps.expectedResult: Validation error for reason is cleared and field shows valid state

steps.action: Fill in the effective date field with valid date
steps.expectedResult: Validation error for effective date is cleared and field shows valid state

steps.action: Click the Submit button to resubmit with all corrected data
steps.expectedResult: Submission succeeds, confirmation message is displayed with request ID, and request is saved to ScheduleChangeRequests table

postconditions: Schedule change request is stored in ScheduleChangeRequests table after correction
Request has a unique ID and timestamp
Request status is set to 'Pending'
No incomplete requests are saved in the database
Validation errors are cleared after successful submission

testCases.title: Ensure draft saving and editing functionality works correctly
preconditions: Employee has valid login credentials
Employee is authenticated via OAuth2
Schedule change request submission page is accessible
ScheduleChangeRequests table is accessible and operational
Draft saving functionality is enabled

steps.action: Navigate to schedule change request submission page
steps.expectedResult: Submission form is displayed with all fields and Save as Draft button is visible

steps.action: Enter valid employee ID in the employee ID field
steps.expectedResult: Employee ID is accepted without validation errors

steps.action: Enter valid current schedule details (date and time)
steps.expectedResult: Current schedule data is accepted without validation errors

steps.action: Leave the requested schedule field empty
steps.expectedResult: Field remains empty without triggering validation errors

steps.action: Leave the reason field empty
steps.expectedResult: Field remains empty without triggering validation errors

steps.action: Leave the effective date field empty
steps.expectedResult: Field remains empty without triggering validation errors

steps.action: Click the Save as Draft button
steps.expectedResult: Draft is saved to ScheduleChangeRequests table with status 'Draft', confirmation message is displayed with draft ID, and no validation errors are shown for incomplete fields

steps.action: Navigate away from the schedule change request submission page
steps.expectedResult: Page navigation occurs without data loss warning

steps.action: Navigate to the list of draft schedule change requests
steps.expectedResult: List of drafts is displayed showing the previously saved draft with correct employee ID and current schedule

steps.action: Select the saved draft to edit
steps.expectedResult: Draft loads correctly in the submission form with previously entered data (employee ID and current schedule) pre-filled

steps.action: Enter valid requested schedule details in the previously empty field
steps.expectedResult: Requested schedule data is accepted without validation errors

steps.action: Enter valid reason in the previously empty field
steps.expectedResult: Reason text is accepted without validation errors

steps.action: Enter valid effective date in the previously empty field
steps.expectedResult: Effective date is accepted without validation errors

steps.action: Click the Submit button to submit the completed request
steps.expectedResult: Request is saved with status changed from 'Draft' to 'Pending', confirmation message is displayed, and request appears in submitted requests list

postconditions: Draft is initially saved with status 'Draft' in ScheduleChangeRequests table
Draft can be retrieved and edited multiple times before submission
After final submission, request status changes to 'Pending'
Completed request has all mandatory fields filled
Request has a unique ID and timestamp for both draft creation and final submission
Draft is no longer visible in drafts list after submission

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to edit or withdraw my schedule change requests before approval to maintain control over submissions

testCases.title: Validate editing of pending schedule change requests
preconditions: Employee has valid login credentials
Employee is authenticated via OAuth2
Employee has at least one pending schedule change request in the system
Employee has at least one approved schedule change request in the system
ScheduleChangeRequests table is accessible and operational
Employee is the owner of the requests

steps.action: Navigate to the list of submitted schedule change requests
steps.expectedResult: List of all submitted requests is displayed showing requests with different statuses (Pending, Approved, etc.) with request ID, submission date, status, and action options

steps.action: Filter or identify pending schedule change requests in the list
steps.expectedResult: Pending requests are clearly visible with status 'Pending' and Edit option is available

steps.action: Select a pending request and click the Edit button
steps.expectedResult: Request details load in edit mode with all fields pre-filled with current data and fields are editable

steps.action: Modify the requested schedule field with a new valid date and time
steps.expectedResult: New requested schedule data is accepted without validation errors

steps.action: Modify the reason field with updated text
steps.expectedResult: Updated reason text is accepted without validation errors

steps.action: Click the Save button to save the edited request
steps.expectedResult: Changes are saved to ScheduleChangeRequests table via PUT /api/schedule-change-requests/{id}, confirmation message is displayed, request status remains 'Pending', and changes are reflected immediately

steps.action: Verify the updated request in the submitted requests list
steps.expectedResult: Request shows updated details with modified requested schedule and reason, and last modified timestamp is updated

steps.action: Select an approved request from the list and attempt to click Edit
steps.expectedResult: Edit option is either disabled/hidden or clicking it displays an error message such as 'Cannot edit approved requests' and no edit form is displayed

steps.action: Attempt to access the edit endpoint directly for an approved request
steps.expectedResult: System prevents edit action, returns appropriate error response, and displays error message indicating that only pending requests can be edited

postconditions: Pending request is successfully updated with new details in ScheduleChangeRequests table
Request status remains 'Pending' after edit
Last modified timestamp is updated
Approved requests remain unchanged and cannot be edited
Audit log contains entry for the edit action
Only request owner can see and perform edit actions

testCases.title: Verify withdrawal of pending schedule change requests
preconditions: Employee has valid login credentials
Employee is authenticated via OAuth2
Employee has at least one pending schedule change request in the system
Employee has at least one approved schedule change request in the system
ScheduleChangeRequests table is accessible and operational
Employee is the owner of the requests
Approvers are configured to receive notifications

steps.action: Navigate to the list of submitted schedule change requests
steps.expectedResult: List of all submitted requests is displayed showing requests with different statuses and action options

steps.action: Select a pending request from the list
steps.expectedResult: Request is selected and Withdraw option is available and enabled

steps.action: Click the Withdraw button for the selected pending request
steps.expectedResult: System displays a confirmation dialog with message such as 'Are you sure you want to withdraw this request?' and options to Confirm or Cancel

steps.action: Click the Confirm button in the confirmation dialog
steps.expectedResult: Request status is updated to 'Withdrawn' in ScheduleChangeRequests table via DELETE /api/schedule-change-requests/{id}, confirmation message is displayed, and approvers are notified immediately of the withdrawal

steps.action: Verify the withdrawn request in the submitted requests list
steps.expectedResult: Request status shows 'Withdrawn', withdrawal timestamp is recorded, and Edit/Withdraw options are no longer available for this request

steps.action: Verify that approvers received notification of the withdrawal
steps.expectedResult: Notification is sent to all assigned approvers with request ID and withdrawal details

steps.action: Select an approved request from the list and attempt to click Withdraw
steps.expectedResult: Withdraw option is either disabled/hidden or clicking it displays an error message such as 'Cannot withdraw approved requests'

steps.action: Attempt to access the withdraw endpoint directly for an approved request
steps.expectedResult: System prevents withdrawal action, returns appropriate error response, and displays error message indicating that only pending requests can be withdrawn

postconditions: Pending request status is changed to 'Withdrawn' in ScheduleChangeRequests table
Withdrawal timestamp is recorded
Approvers receive notification of withdrawal
Approved requests remain unchanged and cannot be withdrawn
Withdrawn request cannot be edited or withdrawn again
Audit log contains entry for the withdrawal action

testCases.title: Ensure only request owner can edit or withdraw requests
preconditions: Two employees (Employee A and Employee B) have valid login credentials
Both employees are authenticated via OAuth2
Employee A has at least one pending schedule change request in the system
Employee B is logged into the system
ScheduleChangeRequests table is accessible and operational
Security controls are properly configured to enforce ownership validation

steps.action: Log in as Employee B
steps.expectedResult: Employee B is successfully authenticated and logged into the system

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to Employee A's pending schedule change request using direct URL or request ID
steps.expectedResult: System denies access and displays error message such as 'You do not have permission to access this request' or redirects to Employee B's own requests

steps.action: Attempt to call PUT /api/schedule-change-requests/{id} endpoint directly for Employee A's request with modified data
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden or 401 Unauthorized error, no changes are made to Employee A's request, and appropriate error message is returned

steps.action: Attempt to call DELETE /api/schedule-change-requests/{id} endpoint directly for Employee A's request
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden or 401 Unauthorized error, Employee A's request status remains unchanged, and appropriate error message is returned

steps.action: Verify that Employee A's request remains unchanged in the database
steps.expectedResult: Request details, status, and timestamps remain exactly as they were before Employee B's unauthorized attempts

steps.action: Log out Employee B and log in as Employee A
steps.expectedResult: Employee A is successfully authenticated and logged into the system

steps.action: Navigate to Employee A's pending schedule change request and click Edit
steps.expectedResult: Request loads in edit mode successfully, allowing Employee A to modify their own request

steps.action: Navigate to Employee A's pending schedule change request and click Withdraw
steps.expectedResult: Withdrawal confirmation dialog is displayed, allowing Employee A to withdraw their own request

postconditions: Employee B cannot edit or withdraw Employee A's requests
Security controls successfully prevent unauthorized access
Employee A's requests remain unchanged after unauthorized access attempts
Employee A retains full control over their own requests
Audit log may contain entries for unauthorized access attempts
No data breach or unauthorized modifications occur

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view the history and audit trail of my schedule change requests to ensure transparency

testCases.title: Validate audit trail display for schedule change requests
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has at least one schedule change request with multiple status changes and comments
Database contains complete audit log entries for the request
Employee has appropriate permissions to view their own requests

steps.action: Employee navigates to the schedule change requests section from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: List of all employee's schedule change requests is displayed with request IDs, dates, and current status

steps.action: Employee selects a specific schedule change request from the list by clicking on it
steps.expectedResult: Request details page opens showing the request information and an audit trail section

steps.action: Employee views the audit trail section on the request details page
steps.expectedResult: Complete chronological history is displayed showing all actions including submission timestamp, status changes (pending, approved, rejected), approver comments, any edits made, and the user who performed each action

steps.action: Employee verifies the timestamps are in chronological order from oldest to newest
steps.expectedResult: All audit entries are displayed in correct chronological sequence with accurate date and time stamps

steps.action: Employee checks that all status changes are reflected in the audit trail
steps.expectedResult: Each status transition (submitted, under review, approved/rejected) is logged with the user who made the change and timestamp

steps.action: Employee reviews approver comments in the audit trail
steps.expectedResult: All comments added by approvers are visible with the commenter's name and timestamp

steps.action: Employee verifies the audit trail loaded within acceptable time
steps.expectedResult: Audit trail data loads and displays within 3 seconds of opening the request details

postconditions: Employee remains on the request details page
Audit trail remains accessible for future viewing
No data is modified during the viewing process
Session remains active

testCases.title: Verify export of audit trail
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has at least one schedule change request with audit trail data
Browser allows file downloads
Employee has access to view their own schedule change requests
PDF export functionality is enabled in the system

steps.action: Employee navigates to their schedule change requests list
steps.expectedResult: List of employee's schedule change requests is displayed

steps.action: Employee selects a specific request to view its details
steps.expectedResult: Request details page opens with audit trail section visible

steps.action: Employee views the audit trail section for the selected request
steps.expectedResult: Complete audit trail is displayed with all historical actions, comments, and status changes

steps.action: Employee locates and verifies the export option is available in the audit trail section
steps.expectedResult: Export button or link is clearly visible and enabled, labeled as 'Export as PDF' or similar

steps.action: Employee clicks on the 'Export as PDF' button
steps.expectedResult: System processes the export request and initiates PDF file download

steps.action: Employee waits for the PDF file to download to their device
steps.expectedResult: PDF file downloads successfully with a meaningful filename (e.g., 'AuditTrail_RequestID_Date.pdf')

steps.action: Employee opens the downloaded PDF file
steps.expectedResult: PDF opens successfully and is properly formatted

steps.action: Employee verifies the PDF contains complete audit information including request ID, all timestamps, status changes, approver comments, and user actions
steps.expectedResult: PDF contains all audit trail data matching what was displayed on screen, properly formatted with headers, chronological order, and readable text

steps.action: Employee checks that the PDF includes request metadata such as request ID, employee name, and export date
steps.expectedResult: PDF header or footer contains request identification information and export timestamp

postconditions: PDF file is saved to employee's download folder
Original audit trail data remains unchanged in the system
Employee remains logged in and on the request details page
Export action is logged in the system audit trail

testCases.title: Ensure access control for audit trail
preconditions: Two employee accounts exist in the system (Employee A and Employee B)
Employee A has created at least one schedule change request
Employee B is logged into the system
Employee B does not own Employee A's schedule change request
Access control security measures are properly configured

steps.action: Employee B logs into the system with their valid credentials
steps.expectedResult: Employee B successfully logs in and sees their dashboard

steps.action: Employee B attempts to access the audit trail of Employee A's schedule change request by directly navigating to the URL (e.g., /api/schedule-change-requests/{Employee_A_Request_ID}/audit) or through any available interface
steps.expectedResult: System denies access and displays an error message such as 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to view this audit trail' or 'Error 403: Forbidden'

steps.action: Employee B verifies they cannot see Employee A's request in their own request list
steps.expectedResult: Employee A's schedule change requests do not appear in Employee B's request list

steps.action: Employee B attempts to access the audit trail using different methods (direct URL manipulation, API calls if accessible)
steps.expectedResult: All access attempts are blocked with appropriate error messages and no audit trail data is displayed

steps.action: Employee B verifies they are redirected or remain on an error page without access to sensitive information
steps.expectedResult: No audit trail information from Employee A's request is visible, and Employee B sees only an error message or is redirected to their own requests page

steps.action: System administrator or Employee A checks system logs for unauthorized access attempts
steps.expectedResult: Unauthorized access attempt by Employee B is logged in the security audit log with timestamp and user details

postconditions: Employee A's audit trail data remains secure and unaccessed by Employee B
Security violation is logged in the system
Employee B remains logged in but has not gained unauthorized access
No data breach or unauthorized data exposure has occurred
